Name: March Forward
About the game: Overview March Forward is a war simulation game controlled by a third-person mode, focusing on subtle troop operations. In the game, you need to choose a troop and command them to win in all kinds of difficult battles. Characteristics Army: There are currently four arms in the game, heavy infantry, light infantry, heavy cavalry, light cavalry. It is not simple mutual restraint between arms, but the need to choose weapons reasonably and use the formation and topographic characteristics to defeat the enemy. Weapons: Different primary and secondary weapons have different effects. Formation: Change the formation in time according to the need of battle. Terrain: Rivers can slow down cavalry charges, trees can block some arrows, mountains can block sight, and make rational use of terrain to win. Combat mode: Long-range troops can use arrows to weaken the enemy, cavalry can launch a charge to defeat the enemy, or fight directly in melee.
Meta Title: March Forward: Oct 15, 2019, Ram and Full Overview
Meta Description: Looking for information on March Forward? Check out the release date (Oct 15, 2019), developer insights from Ram, and a complete game summary.
